name: pterodactyl
description: Pterodactyl Panel is a self-hosted game server management platform. It supports multiple game servers with Docker isolation, user access controls, and admin dashboards.
features: Game server management: Host and manage multiple game servers including Minecraft, CS:GO, and Rust.
Docker isolation: Run each game server in isolated Docker containers for security and resource control.
User access control: Create user accounts with granular permissions for server management and file access.
File manager: Edit server configuration files directly through the web interface with syntax highlighting.
Console access: View real-time server console output and send commands through the web interface.
Backup automation: Schedule automatic backups of game servers with retention policies and restoration.
Resource limits: Set CPU, memory, and disk limits per server to prevent resource exhaustion.
Startup management: Configure server startup parameters, environment variables, and boot sequences.
Multi-node support: Distribute game servers across multiple physical nodes for scalability.
API access: Automate server management and provisioning using a comprehensive RESTful API.
Subuser system: Grant limited access to specific servers for players or moderators.
Activity logging: Track all server actions, file changes, and user activity for auditing.
